Clarifying the concept of īmān and its components
The Quran teaches that faith (īmān) grows through action (Q 48:4), and the Prophet ﷺ often emphasized that deeds are a part of īmān. īmān encompasses the statement of the tongue, belief in the heart, and action with the limbs. We reject the idea (like Murjiʾah) that īmān is only knowledge or belief in the heart alone. Essential to īmān is belief in Allah, angels, messengers, and the last day.
